content:
用工個們可民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第107.2195786號通知單註銷密等
23 July 1957
In the view of the WHO Expert Committee on Influenza, vaccination holds out the best hope of reducing the effects of an epidemic, but in order to be effective the vaccine must be prepared from the epidemic strain. Vaccines already prepared from previously isolated strains are ineffective against the new virus. Vaccine production using the new virus is already underway in a number of countries, but it is clear that the supply will be insufficient to meet the demand. There will certainly be insufficient for the vaccination of large proportions of populations. In some countries, therefore, vaccine is being reserved for selected groups either because they are specially exposed . to infection or because sickness of a large proportion simultaneously would result in severe dislocation of essential services or economic loss.
Because of the anticipated shortage of vaccine we would recommend that all laboratories with adequate facilities should be encouraged to initiate production without delay. The virus needed for vaccine production is available from the World Influenza Centre (National Institute for Medical Research, The Ridgeway, Mill Hill, London, N. W.7, United Kingdom ) and from the International Influenza Centre for the Americas (Communicable Disease Centre, United States Public Health Service, P.O. Box 61, Montgomery 1, Alabama, United States of America ). It has already been distributed to all WHO Influenza Centres.
It is suggested that countries with good facilities for large-scale vaccine production should, after satisfying their priority requirements, make available at the lowest economic price any surplus vaccine for priority groups in countries less favourably situated. The World Health Organization is willing to act as intermediary in any such arrangement. It is furthermore suggested that countries with facilities for vaccine production in which the epidemic has already occurred and has died out, should as a temporary measure make available their production to countries not yet affected.
I have the honour to be,
Sir, Your obedient Servant, Dorothe
for M. G. Candau, M.D. Director-General
6
國史饭 Academia Historica
